text: president Trump hasn't had much luck
convincing Congress to get rid of
Obamacare but he still determined to
dismantle Barack Obama's health care
reforms let obamacare implode so how
would that happen well here in the US
health care is a business so if we look
at it like one of the Trump hotels how
would you try and shut it down well
there are three ways will let Obamacare
fail one of the simplest ways is for the
president to continue bad-mouthing it on
the cat when you say let's let it fail
let's let it implode it does become a
self-fulfilling prophecy
I mean look for better or for worse this
law was designed to deliver a public
entitlement through private insurance
companies that are in it to make a
profit and not only if he did that with
one of his hotels saying it's this
nightmare all this skyrocketing cost all
this pain
well don't want to stay there anymore
poor Trump's a businessman keep talking
a commodity down it loses its value the
second way he could take down Abama care
is by cutting government payments to
insurance companies
it's those subsidies which help keep
costs down and they're worth around 7
billion dollars if they're cut well that
could lead to insurers either leaving
the market completely or in the best
case scenario raising premiums as much
as 20% as soon as the president were to
stop subsidizing hotel rooms for example
in some places would have to shut down
it could leave people stranded if
there's no longer a hotel in their area
or in the case of health care it could
leave people without an insurance
provider and then there's one more
option the president could use to derail
Obamacare leave people with a bad
customer experience the Obama
administration put a lot of money into
encouraging people to sign up for
Obamacare things like ads and walk-in
centers where people talk to you through
the process but in January President
Trump cut funding for this they have a
proposal to dramatically reduce the
consumer assistance budget that's
essentially for when consumers are
coming to the website and they need to
figure out are there am I eligible for
subsidies what can I sign up for they
often have questions and back to that
hotel it's a bit like cutting the
advertising budget so people don't know
your hotel exists anymore or taking away
your front desk staff so you can't check
in and that's where of course the
comparisons end because health care
isn't an ordinary business in the u.s.
it's a matter of life and death as we've
shown President Trump can let Obamacare
implode but it isn't as simple as that
perhaps he's using the threat of that
option as a way of forcing Congress to
come up with a credible alternative
[Music]
